bug.summary: Be confused by the memory format NCHW and NHWC
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel/mkl-dnn/blob/b5f3e6e09e970d9766b73d8237619c55e93a88ee/examples/memory_format_propagation.cpp#L165>https://github.com/intel/mkl-dnn/blob/b5f3e6e09e970d9766b73d8237619c55e93a88ee/examples/memory_format_propagation.cpp#L165</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-code>/// We assume that the 'user' source and destination memory format is
     /// NHWC. Since there is no result validation in this tutorial, we do not
     /// bother with filling the data with some values and let the Intel
     /// DNNL library to allocate the memory.
     ///
     /// @snippet memory_format_propagation.cpp Create source and destination memory objects
     // [Create source and destination memory objects]
     auto src_mem = memory(
             {{N, IC, H, W}, memory::data_type::f32, memory::format_tag::nchw},
             eng);
 </denchmark-code>
 
 As the comment says, we assume source memory format is NHWC, but the statement seems to define src_mem as memory::format_tag::nchw, I'm confused.
 When I change src men to nchw, and use reorder to transform NCHW to NHWC, I got could not create a reorder primitive descriptor.

comments.comment: The comment has a typo, the intended format is NCHW. We'll fix this. It is hard to say what's up with the reorder without looking at some code...

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rsdubtso>@rsdubtso</denchmark-link>
If I change the below code <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel/mkl-dnn/blob/6f54e5b78925c16a19fc11b1453cdcbfc37951f0/examples/memory_format_propagation.cpp#L164-L166>https://github.com/intel/mkl-dnn/blob/6f54e5b78925c16a19fc11b1453cdcbfc37951f0/examples/memory_format_propagation.cpp#L164-L166</denchmark-link>
to auto src_mem = memory({{N, H, W, IC}, memory::data_type::f32, memory::format_tag::nhwc}, cpu_engine); I assume that bool need_reorder_src = conv_pd.src_desc() != src_mem.get_desc(); will get true and if (need_reorder_src) { auto reorder_src = reorder(src_mem, conv_src_mem); reorder_src.execute( s, {{DNNL_ARG_FROM, src_mem}, {DNNL_ARG_TO, conv_src_mem}}); s.wait(); // wait for the reorder to complete } will reorder src_mem (nhwc) to selected format of Conv_src_mem(e.g. nChw8c). But I get
DNNL error: could not create a reorder primitive descriptor Error status: invalid_arguments
So, what should I do, if my input data is nhwc? thanks

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wayneshawn>@wayneshawn</denchmark-link> , Tensor dimensions always follow logical order that does not depend on the memory format. So you do not need to change {N, IC, H, W} to {N, H, W, IC}. Changing the format tag alone (and the way you populate buffer) is enough.
